data.title: The 14th Infantry Division
data.text:
This unit was formed in October 1934 in Leipzig. It was originally known as Wehrgauleitung Leipzig. Shortly after the unit was established it was given the cover name Kommandant von Leipzig. The organic regimental units of this division were formed by the expansion of the 11.(Sächsisches) Infanterie-Regiment of the 4.Division of the Reichswehr.

With the formal announcement of the creation of the Wehrmacht (which had covertly been in place for over a year) on October 15th, 1935, the cover name Kommandant von Leipzig was dropped and this unit became offically known as the 14.Infanterie-Division.

On October 15th, 1940, the 14.Infanterie-Division was reformed as the 14.Infanterie-Division (mot.). The conversion was completed by March 3rd, 1941.

In 1943 the 14.Infanterie-Division (mot.) was de-motorised after an attempt to reform it into the 14.Panzergrenadier-Divison failed. This process began on May 1st, 1943 and the division was then redesignated the 14.Infanterie-Division on June 30th, 1943

When the planned redesignation of the 14.Infanterie-Division (mot.) into the 14.Panzer-Grenadier-Division did not take place, Infanterie-Regiment 101 was reformed. Infanterie-Regiment 101 from the original 14.Infanterie-Division was transfered along with the rest of the division when it became the 14.Infanterie-Division (mot.), but it was soon transfered again to the 18.Panzer-Division. When the 14.Infanterie-Division (mot.) became the 14.Infanterie-Division, Infanterie-Regiment 101 was reformed. The original Infanterie-Regiment 101 became Schutzen-Regiment 101 when it was sent to the 18.Panzer-Division.

Organization

1940

Infanterie-Regiment 11

Infanterie-Regiment 53

Infanterie-Regiment 101

Artillerie-Regiment 14

I./Artillerie-Regiment 50

14th Divisional Support Units

1943

Infanterie-Regiment 11

Infanterie-Regiment 53

Infanterie-Regiment 101

Artillerie-Regiment 14

Füsilier-Abteilung 14

Kradschutzen-Abteilung 54 14th Divisional Support Units

Campaigns

·Poland 1939

· Western Campaign 1940 March trough Holland(Limburg,occupation of Belgium (Duinkerke), occupation of France

· Eastern Front 1943-1945 Barbarossa and retreat from Russia

Commanders:

OberstErich Friderici 4.01.34 - 10.01.35

Gen.Lt. Franz Freiherr Kreb von Kressenstein 10.01.35 - 10.06.36

Gen.Lt. Peter Weyer 10.06.36 - 6.15.40

Gen.Maj. Lothar Rendulic 6.15.40 - 10.6.40

General der Infanterie Kommandierende General XXXV Armeekorps Ironcross with oakleaf 15-8-43

Gen.Lt. Friedrich Fürst10.6.40 - into 14.Inf.Div.(mot)

Generalmajor Hermann Flörke from 14.Inf.Div.(mot) - 12.28.44

Generalleutnant Erich Schneider 12.28.44 - 3.20.45

Ironcross with oakleaf 6-3-45

Generalmajor Paul von Below ??.??.45 - ??.??.45

Oberst ?? Kirch??.??.45 - ??.??.45

Generalmajor Werner Schulze 3.??.45 - 4.??.45

As you can see we are missing some data. Is you can fill in the gaps please let me know!
